thread.title: Practice makes perfect for England rugby team
thread.title_full: Practice makes perfect for England rugby team - Telegraph

author: Oliver Pickup
title: Practice makes perfect for England rugby team
text: Since the advent of professionalism in the mid Nineties, the way international rugby teams prepare for matches has changed beyond recognition. England’s attention to detail is a good example. Their training base – the luxurious Pennyhill Park hotel near Bagshot in Surrey – has a purpose-built training centre featuring a pitch that has the same dimensions and grass as Twickenham. The build-up intensifies in the week before a match, and the demands on the players become as great off the training pitch as on it, as this typical schedule shows. Monday Video analysis of any recent matches precedes training at Pennyhill Park. Players are put up for media interviews. Tuesday Another training session – and a final chance to impress head coach Stuart Lancaster – plus more media duties. Wednesday A day off for the players, on which Lancaster will speak to each to inform them of his team for the coming match. Thursday The team is announced. A final training session, finetuning moves and set-pieces. Friday A rest day from training but not from the world’s media. Saturday Match day. The wait is over. • For more information on health and lifestyle, visit vitality.com
